title: You decided to play Lissandra to counter the other team's Zed
body:
[](http://ddragon.leagueoflegends.com/cdn/img/champion/splash/Lissandra_0.jpg)But you have never actually played her before.

https://i.imgflip.com/16hplw.gif

replies.body: Who didn't ban Zed is the bigger problem here
A person who is decent enough to know that Zed, if handled, has zero chance in winning this game.
Funny how it's only Zed players that defend him.
Yeah, they are the only ones who know his weaknesses. All the others just see a flash as he hits the ADC.
All the other players see the biggest bullshit in the laning phase...and then can one shot any non-tank regardless of how he did in lane.
So. Lets talk about Vayne or Garen? I really prefer fighting Zed 1v1 over those 2.
Vayne's lane isn't good? Nor would I say Garen's is either lol...Garen does have the ability to kill people if they are the villain when behind, but he is also easy to stay away from.
Garen is a lane bully. What are you talking about?
Too bad I am slower than Garen.

If you have a problem with Garen you must have a problem with all juggernauts. You will die to pretty much any of them if they catch you out. They aren't really designed to 1v1 though, you should avoid fighting them head on when possible. I certainly think they are an unhealthy subset of champs that suffer from a similar problem as Zed (Darius is especially bad), but the issue with Zed is more his constant laning pressure and safety not his 1v1.
I am da Juggernaut Mordekaiser. Its just that he beats the **** out of me 1v1 when I am Morde.

I have never tried that matchup, but I would guess that Garen wins because of his silence. Morde is kind of a caster juggernaut so that silence really hurts. If they changed his Q from a silence to Grounded do you still think he would win?
I honestly don't know. I am mostly afraid of his spinning slash.
That is certainly most of his damage, but I would think you could out damage him if that was all he had.
sounds like a personal problem.

You talk about him being strong, but the 46% winrate says otherwise.  You should ask all the pro players why they never ban Zed, I bet its because they are all zed players.  You should do yourself a favor and learn how to lane if you are still having problems with Zed.

LOL.

Though Liss doesn't really need experience. Zed ults you? Hit R.
True, but the rest of your game will be a bit more challenging.

nope, press R

j/k :)
And spam the Q all time. BTW to me Pantheon and Jayce with exhaust are better to counter Zed.

> [{quoted}](name=KyubiIsMyBiitch,realm=EUW,application-id=Ir7ZrJjF,discussion-id=gQUEOF6E,comment-id=00000001,timestamp=2016-06-27T11:43:07.144+0000)
>
> And spam the Q all time. BTW to me Pantheon and Jayce with exhaust are better to counter Zed.

Urgot is also a great Zed counterpick. He's got his passive that can reduce Zed's damage by 15% by hitting him, he's got his suppression-into-30/40/50% damage reduction ultimate, and he's got his Terror Capacitor shield. Frozen Heart is also a core item on Urgot.

Lissandra is a relatively easy champion to pick up. She's part of the ten initial champions for a reason.

EDIT: Her skills aren't that complex. She's got a boatload of damage with crowd control in relatively easy skillshots, along with a point and click ultimate. She can self-cast her ult when she's in danger, and her E gives her an engage and a disengage. She builds tanky and can punish melee champions extremely effectively. Her passive is probably the hardest part of her kit to play around, since as a beginner, one normally wants to spam abilities, which forces Lissandra to run out of mana very quickly. I'm saying this as someone who played Lissandra as his first champion and who still plays her to this day as my second favorite mage...
So is kha'zix...

Kha main, and to be fair, Kha has simple mechanics at a base, and not too many complicated ones (but they exist) 

So maybe thats why he's there. 

The harder part about kha is knowing when to jump in and out. _"But thats on every assassin dude"_ Well, yes it is on most, but kha has to deal with isolation. IDK what the easiest assassin for a new player would be, maybe its kha. I'd say put Kat, but maybe they wanted an AD assassin
Easiest assassin is probably Talon.
I'd say Warwick

That beautiful Ulti one shot.

{{item:1419}} {{item:3153}} {{item:3091}} Red buff 

Perfect
patch 4.20 redsmite devourer warwick *shudders*
Don't worry. That build still one shots

no you doing it wrong
{{item:3115}} {{item:3100}} {{item:3089}}
I was thinking of mentioning him, but i don't play him enough to be certain
Mechanically he's the simplest. Goes right to the target- no real skillshots- rub face on keyboard and either they'll be dead or you'll be dead. Simple as it gets.
Cool, might pick him up. I love me some assassins

Kha'Zix and Ryze are the only two champions that I don't think should be there.

In depth guide to playing Lissandra:

**Q THE THINGS**(also press R)

You forgot:

Press W when the melees get close, and press E when you need to escape.

Same when my team wanted me to play Talon to counter the enemies Kassadin.

Let's just say it didn't went well
Damn that kass must have been really good because talon just destroys him harder than garen v riven
Maybe that, but I definitely am a really bad Talon
See I tried to give you the benefit of the doubt.
Why play Lissandra when you can play AP Janna mid? xD
Fuck yeah, I love that matchup
I did this with Kayle once ;-;

I feel you, bro...

https://i.imgflip.com/16huqg.gif

I know the counter to zed..
http://leaguememe.com/uploads/league/1495499592.jpg
I have not lost a game to Zed mid when I was mid. Just pick Pantheon. He wrecks Zed early game.
I love when people pick {{champion:127}} {{champion:10}} against me when I play {{champion:238}} a free win most of the time since they have no idea what they're doing.
Kayle is a better counter to Zed than Lissandra imo
